Title: MOWAA controversy: Edo Assembly threatens arrest warrant on Obaseki, others
Summary: Edo State House of Assembly Ad-hoc Committee, constituted to investigate the Museum of West African Art (MOWAA) and Radisson Hotel, is investigating . Edo Assembly threatens arrest warrant on Obaseki, others .

Title: S’Court justice declares forensic practice pillar of justice administration
Summary: S’Court justice declares forensic practice pillar of justice administration . Abraham Moore Adumein declared that the justice system depends on credible evidence, effective .

Title: Enugu LG boss launches ‘Operation Kwechiri’, patrol vehicles to fight insecurity
Summary: Enugu LG boss launches ‘Operation Kwechiri’, patrol vehicles to fight insecurity . Chairman of Uzo-Uwani Local Council of Enugu State, Chijioke Ezugwu, has launched "Operation Kwchiri," a special security force .

Title: How stigma, poor treatment, funding hobble HIV/AIDS roll back
Summary: HIV response in Nigeria has moved beyond the battle against stigmatisation to a fight for the continuity of lifesaving treatment . HIV response is now a fight against stigma, poor treatment, funding and stigmatisation .

Title: Insecurity: Defence minister vows swift gains as NSA warns enemies, labour talks tough
Summary: Nigeria’s newly appointed Minister of Defence, General Christopher Musa (rtd), yesterday said Nigerians would see tangible progress . General Musa, who was appointed as the new minister of defence, says Nigerians will see 'tangible progress'

Title: Nigeria gave UK a future prime minister in Kemi Badenoch  —  Boris Johnson
Summary: Boris Johnson praised the longstanding ties between Nigeria and the UK . He praised the exchange of talent that sustains their relationship . Johnson said Nigeria gave UK a future prime minister in Kemi Badenoch .

Title: Lagos must think bigger, act smarter — Adedipe, George
Summary: Renowned economist Professor Biodun Adedipe said Lagos State must aggressively deepen wealth creation . He said the state must build an inclusive, resilient, and globally competitive economy . Speaking at the Roundtable Discussion on Lagos Economic Outlook 2026 .

Title: ‘Nigeria close to defeating insecurity’
Summary: Peace advocate and intelligence expert, John Metchie, expressed hope that Nigeria is on the path to ending insecurity . He said the National Security Adviser, NSA, Nuhu Ribadu, should be commended for his strategic brilliance and uncommon resolve .

Title: NAHCO details arrest of ex-staff convicted for 25kg drug theft
Summary: Mr Sunday Adakole stole a 25-kilogramme drum of ephedrine hydrochloride from the company’s warehouse at the Murtala Muhammed Airport in Lagos . NAHCO Aviance has clarified how it discovered, arrested and handed over its former junior staff .

Title: ‘You need 6 years to be lawyer’; judge rejects Nnamdi Kanu’s brother’s court appearance
Summary: Judge rejects Nnamdi Kanu's brother’s court appearance . “When I said representation, it is not his (Kanu's) father, brother, sister or relations I meant. I mean his counsel"

Title: FG sets Dec 20 deadline to pay contractors
Summary: All Indigenous Contractors Association of Nigeria staged a protest at the Federal Ministry of Finance over alleged unpaid funds for projects executed in 2024 . Minister of Works, David Umahi, gave the assurance during the reopening of the repaired flyover in Nasarawa State .

Title: Edo gov gets new CPS
Summary: Ebojele is a renowned journalist, public administrator, researcher, and lecturer with an extensive and distinguished professional record in media practice, public affairs, and academia . Title: Court defers Kanu’s transfer appeal, rejects brother’s representation
Summary: Federal High Court in Abuja fixed December 8 for the hearing of a motion ex parte filed by the leader of the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra, Nnamdi Kanu, seeking to be transferred from the Sokoto Correctional Facility . Kanu was found guilty of all seven counts of terrorism charges preferred against him by

Title: CAF, teammates hail Ekong after retirement
Summary: William Troost-Ekong announced his retirement from international football on Thursday . The 32-year-old defender confirmed the decision in an emotional video posted on social media . Ekong made 83 appearances for Nigeria throughout his decade-long spell and scored eight goals . The announcement has drawn tributes from teammates and football authorities .

Title: 2026 Hajj: NAHCON unveils guidelines on flights, medicals, others
Summary: The National Hajj Commission of Nigeria has released a comprehensive set of directives for the 2026 Hajj, introducing strict new rules on flight management, pilgrim grouping, medical fitness, and data submission . The measures were announced on December 4, 2025 following a meeting with State Pilgrims’ Welfare Boards .
